articles.headline: Microsoft Faces New Browser Foe in Google
articles.snippet: Google will release a free Web browser called Chrome that the company said would challenge Internet Explorer.
articles.abstract: Google will release a free Web browser called Chrome that the company said would challenge Internet Explorer.
articles.lead_paragraph: The browser war is back on.

articles.headline: For Widely Used Drug, Question of Usefulness Is Still Lingering
articles.snippet: Zetia and Vytorin are heavily prescribed despite a lack of proof the cholesterol drugs help to prolong life or prevent heart attacks.
articles.abstract: Zetia and Vytorin are heavily prescribed despite a lack of proof the cholesterol drugs help to prolong life or prevent heart attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Food and Drug Administration approved a new type of cholesterol-lowering medicine in 2002, it did so on the basis of a handful of clinical trials covering a total of 3,900 patients. None of the patients took the medicine for more than 12 weeks, and the trials offered no evidence that it had reduced heart attacks or cardiovascular disease, the goal of any cholesterol drug.

articles.headline: For Airlines, No End in Sight to Fuel-Cost Struggles
articles.snippet: The nation’s airlines had hoped for a fresh start after Labor Day, with streamlined schedules and smaller fleets that were meant to help them cope better with the high cost of jet fuel.
articles.abstract: The nation’s airlines had hoped for a fresh start after Labor Day, with streamlined schedules and smaller fleets that were meant to help them cope better with the high cost of jet fuel.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s airlines had hoped for a fresh start after Labor Day, with streamlined schedules and smaller fleets that were meant to help them cope better with the high cost of jet fuel.

articles.headline: Palin Disclosures Raise Questions on Vetting
articles.snippet: The disclosure that Gov. Sarah Palin’s daughter was pregnant was one of several revelations that called into question how well John McCain had screened her.
articles.abstract: The disclosure that Gov. Sarah Palin’s daughter was pregnant was one of several revelations that called into question how well John McCain had screened her.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL  A series of disclosures about Gov. Sarah Palin, Senator John McCain’s choice as running mate, called into question on Monday how thoroughly Mr. McCain had examined her background before putting her on the Republican presidential ticket.

articles.headline: Spared a Direct Hit, New Orleans Exhales
articles.snippet: The storm spared a nearly deserted New Orleans but raised fears of coastal erosion and damage to rural areas.
articles.abstract: The storm spared a nearly deserted New Orleans but raised fears of coastal erosion and damage to rural areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by Adam Nossiter, Damien Cave, Kareem Fahim and James Barron.
articles.byline: By Adam Nossiter, Damien Cave, Kareem Fahim and James Barron

articles.headline: A New Twist in the Debate on Mothers
articles.snippet: Gov. Sarah Palin has set off a fierce argument among women about whether she has the time to take on the vice presidency.
articles.abstract: Gov. Sarah Palin has set off a fierce argument among women about whether she has the time to take on the vice presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Gov. Sarah Palin of Alaska was introduced as a vice-presidential pick, she was presented as a magnet for female voters, the epitome of everymom appeal.
articles.byline: By Jodi Kantor and Rachel L. Swarns

articles.headline: At Movies, Fewer Eyes, Bigger Haul
articles.snippet: Fewer people went to the movies this summer than last, but higher ticket prices and a Batman sequel delivered near-record revenue to the major studios.
articles.abstract: Fewer people went to the movies this summer than last, but higher ticket prices and a Batman sequel delivered near-record revenue to the major studios.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Fewer people went to the movies this summer than last, confirming Hollywood’s fears that this year’s slate of pictures would not match the crowd pleasers of 2007.

articles.headline: Gulf Oil Industry Seems Unscathed
articles.snippet: Waves of relief rather than water washed over the oil patch after Hurricane Gustav’s punch appeared to be much less powerful than those of Hurricanes Rita and Katrina three years ago.
articles.abstract: Waves of relief rather than water washed over the oil patch after Hurricane Gustav’s punch appeared to be much less powerful than those of Hurricanes Rita and Katrina three years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON  Waves of relief rather than water washed over the oil patch after Hurricane Gustav’s punch appeared to be much less powerful than those of Hurricanes Rita and Katrina three years ago.

articles.headline: And They Could Call It Frannie
articles.snippet: Here’s a bold idea: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac should merge. Outrageous? Maybe, but it’s certainly worth considering as the value of their shares continues to wither.
articles.abstract: Here’s a bold idea: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac should merge. Outrageous? Maybe, but it’s certainly worth considering as the value of their shares continues to wither.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here’s a bold idea: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac should merge.
